title: How to Freeze Your Smoothie Greens

steps.headline: Wash your greens.
steps.description: Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there.

steps.headline: Add a cup of water to the blender.
Start putting greens in your blender.
steps.description: Start out with a couple of handfuls. Puree them for a few seconds.

steps.headline: Keep adding more.
steps.description: Be sure not to overwhelm your blender. A 600 watt blender is OK, but higher is better, in this instance.

steps.headline: Know the strength of your blender.
steps.description: You can mix greens the same you do when you are making your smoothies.

steps.headline: Blend for about a minute or so, or until the greens are finely chopped.
Pour them into the molds you have chosen.
steps.description: Keep in mind the strength of your blender and size them accordingly.

steps.headline: Freeze the molds until they are completely frozen.
Take them out of the molds and put them in a freezer bag.
steps.description: Leaving them in the mold will cause them to get freezer burn and becoming stale, from being open.

steps.headline: Wash your greens.
steps.description: Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there.

steps.headline: Add them to the freezer bags.
Get as much of the air out of the bag as possible.
Break them off as you want to use them.
Wash your greens.
steps.description: Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there.

steps.headline: Put them in the freezer bag, making sure to get all of the air out of the bag.

text: Blending and Freezing Wash your greens. Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there. Add a cup of water to the blender.  Start putting greens in your blender. Start out with a couple of handfuls. Puree them for a few seconds. Keep adding more. Be sure not to overwhelm your blender. A 600 watt blender is OK, but higher is better, in this instance. Know the strength of your blender. You can mix greens the same you do when you are making your smoothies. Blend for about a minute or so, or until the greens are finely chopped.  Pour them into the molds you have chosen. Keep in mind the strength of your blender and size them accordingly. Freeze the molds until they are completely frozen.  Take them out of the molds and put them in a freezer bag. Leaving them in the mold will cause them to get freezer burn and becoming stale, from being open. Freezing the Greens Wash your greens. Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there. Add them to the freezer bags.  Get as much of the air out of the bag as possible.  Break them off as you want to use them.  Freezing Blanched Green Leaves Wash your greens. Even if the containers say that they are pre-washed. You want to make sure that all of the greens are fresh and not starting to spoil and also get rid of any leftover dirt that might be there. Blanch the greens.  Put them in the freezer bag, making sure to get all of the air out of the bag.
